sect1.title: Identifying your modem
sect1.para: Most dialup modems are not supported by Ubuntu, but drivers can be found that will enable the use of such modems. First you need to identify what chipset your dialup modem is using:
sect1.screen: wget -c &scanmodem-url; gunzip -c &scanmodem-gz; > scanModem chmod +x scanModem sudo ./scanModem gedit Modem/ModemData.txt
sect1.para: Much more detailed information is available on the community wiki.

sect1.title: Connecting with a modem
sect1.para: Network Manager provide graphical tools to configure a modem connection.

important.para: You will need to know the following information:
ISP Phone Number; Username; Password; Domain Name Server (DNS) addresses.

step.para: Choose Properties and fill out the fields.
Click add, enter your DNS address.
